title: I can jump puddles. Ep. 7
creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, John Gauci and Keith Wilkes
brief_description: A 9 part television serial about Australian author Alan Marshall, from his childhood and his diagnosis with Polio to his adulthood as he struggles to become a writer. Based on his three autobiographical novels “I can Jump Puddles”, ‘This is the Grass” and “How Beautiful are thy Feet”. When a story he submits is rejected, Alan, age 20, returns to the city to work. Quickly applying for a clerical position, Alan is offered the job, on the condition he accepts less than the award wage. On the condition that if after 6 months, his employer, Mrs. Smalpeck, is pleased with his work, she raise his wage to match those of equal capability, he agrees. Boarding at a local boarding house run by the eccentric Mrs. Birdsworth, Alan continues his observation of the world around him.
